taskDescription: Initialize a .NET 10 HelloWorld solution with randomized multilingual greetings and unit tests

userStories.title: .NET Initialization
userStories.description: Create a new .NET 10 solution with a console application scaffolded in a standard repository layout to serve as a clean foundation for further development.
acceptanceCriteria: A .slnx file exists at the repository root
The console project is located at src/HelloWorld
userStories.notes: Use modern SDK-style project defaults. Ensure TreatWarningsAsErrors=true and Nullable=enable in the project file. Solution uses .slnx format.

userStories.title: Hello World
userStories.description: Implement greeting logic so that the application prints exactly one random greeting in different languages on each start.
acceptanceCriteria: Project is added to the existing solution
Running the application prints exactly one greeting
The output includes the greeting text
The output includes the corresponding language
The greeting is selected from a predefined list
The application can be executed using dotnet run
userStories.notes: Keep a fixed in-code list (e.g., array) of (Language, Greeting) pairs. Randomize selection per startup. Output format should be deterministic enough for tests (e.g., "<Greeting> (<Language>)").

userStories.title: Tests
userStories.description: Add unit tests for the greeting logic so that the selection behavior can be reliably verified.
acceptanceCriteria: The test project is part of the existing solution
The test project references the HelloWorld project
Tests validate only predefined greetings can be returned
userStories.notes: Place test project at tests/HelloWorld.Tests. Use xUnit (or NUnit/MSTest). Prefer testing a GreetingProvider/service that returns a greeting tuple rather than asserting console output.
